1656.text:
- they wouldn't hurt their heads. 
- Yes. 
- Like a helmet.

1658.text: To protect them when learning to walk.

1660.text: Who joined Santa's sleigh team in 1939? BEEP

1666.text: Rudolph the Red-nosed Reindeer. SLEIGH BELLS

1669.text: And the sound of Santa's sleigh bells tells me

1671.text: that playtime has to come to an end.

1674.text: But before we hang up our stockings and go to bed,

1676.text: let's have a look at our final scores.

1679.text: Kate and Hallie, you did very, very well in that round

1682.text: because you got some points and made up your total to nine.

1687.text: But I'm afraid it is only half

1690.text: of Lars and Nina's triumphant score of 18.

1698.text: You've won the last of our series because we've come

1701.text: to the end of our time here in this, the world's ultimate toy box.

1708.text: being grown-up is a terribly hard thing to do.

1710.text: It's much easier to skip it and go from one childhood to another.

1713.text: And so we must thank the museum here today for preserving

1716.text: so many childhood memories for us.

1718.text: Thank you, goodbye and merry Christmas.
